string.name: desc1
string.i: Apply direct pressure to the wound with a clean cloth or bandage. Elevate the bleeding area if possible. Hold pressure for at least 10 minutes. If bleeding continues, seek medical attention immediately.

string.name: desc2
string.i: Clean the wound with mild soap and cool water. Remove any dirt or debris. Apply a sterile bandage to protect the wound from infection.

string.name: desc3
string.i: For small burns, cool the area with running cool water for 10-15 minutes. Avoid using ice directly on the burn. Cover the burn with a loose sterile bandage. Do not break blisters. For larger burns or burns that cause white or charred skin, seek medical attention immediately.

string.name: desc4
string.i: Apply ice to the injured area for 20 minutes at a time, wrapped in a cloth to avoid direct skin contact. Rest the injured area and elevate it if possible. Compress the area with a bandage to reduce swelling.

string.name: desc5
string.i: For adults who are conscious and coughing: Encourage them to continue coughing. Do not perform the Heimlich maneuver unless coughing is ineffective. For adults who are unconscious and not breathing: Call emergency services immediately and begin CPR if you are trained.

string.name: desc6
string.i: Clean the area with soap and water. Apply a cold compress to reduce swelling. Calamine lotion can help relieve itching. Remove any stingers with tweezers, avoiding squeezing the venom sac.

string.name: desc7
string.i: If someone is experiencing a severe allergic reaction (anaphylaxis), call emergency services immediately. Look for signs like difficulty breathing, swelling of the face or throat, or hives. If the person has an EpiPen, help them administer it if you are trained to do so.

string.name: fireH
string.b: Here are some quick reaction tips on common fire incidences:

resources.string: Secure Yourself: The most important thing is to ensure your safety and the safety of others around you. If you feel threatened, get to a safe location and lock yourself in if possible.\ Minimize Movement: Avoid disturbing the scene or potential evidence.\ Call911 (or your local emergency number): This should be your first priority after securing yourself. Describe the situation clearly and concisely, including your location and any details about the suspect(s).\ Stay Calm: Take deep breaths and try to remain calm. This will help you think clearly and provide accurate information to the dispatcher.
